intro: Phyteuma austriacum, commonly known as the Austrian bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central Europe. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with lance-shaped leaves that are hairy on the underside. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and rocky areas. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and conservation efforts.
